column4: my nvidia 6800GT is about 58 degrees celsius when i'm in ordinary Gnome. is this much?
that isn't terrible
how can i improve it? is there any settings i could "lower" to reduce the heat produced?
no.
have you overclock anything on your computer?
someone said lowering the bpp to 16 instead of 24 would help. nothing is overclocked
I think you will be fine with those temps, you don't plan on running any 3d environments do you?
i plan to run games, but my computer crashes often when i do.
trying seeing if you have fresh thermal paste/adequate cooling flow through your computer
how long have you been using ubuntu?
ok, i should check the installation of the fan. it's custom installed by my little brother :D
3 years
thats probably your culprit
I have an old 6800GT in my server and It never breaks 40C
you have any Ideas about my refresh rate problem?
sorry, i didn't see your question.
you've added the horiz and vert sync to your xorg.conf?
what should it look like if I want it at 60hz?

you have to add info to your xorg.conf about your monitor. you cannot simply choose a refresh rate, as this would be different with different resolutions. you need to add two values in the xorg.conf, the horizontal and vertical sync. these can usually be found in your monitor manual
wish me luck I'm gonna restart
thanks for the help you helped solve the epic 2 day battle against my monitor
